CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 1, 1964, pg. 7 reads: "Kappa Silhouettes - This attractive group is composed of the wives of members of Kappa Alpha Psi Fraternity and are called Kappa Silhouettes. The charmers were hostesses at a Black and White Ball, last Friday night, at the Hotel Penn-Sheraton.  Left to right: Mmes. James Willis, Ralph Barnett, Robert W. Smith, James A. Stewart, president; Howard Thomas and Stafford Evans.  Back row: Mmes. John Smith, Alfred Carl, Marshall Johnson, James Greenlee, Andrew Turner, Robert Mungin Gregory Pitts, Leon Ford, Alma B. Davis, and Langston Lewis. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of sixteen Kappa Silhouette members, seated, left to right: Rose Willis, Ann Barnett, Helen Smith, Ethel Stewart, Harriet Thomas, and Helen Evans;  standing, left to right: Marian Smith, Mrs. Alfred Carl, Mrs. Marshall Johnson, Ruth Greenlee, Fran Turner, Mrs. Robert Mungin, Nancy Pitts, Louise Ford, Alma B. Davis, and Mrs. Langston Lewis, gathered in Penn Sheraton Hotel for Kappa Alpha Psi Black and White Ball, another version
